oceans.name: Pacific Ocean
oceans.description: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's five oceanic divisions. It extends from the Arctic Ocean in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south and is bounded by Asia and Australia in the west and the Americas in the east.
fun_facts: It covers about 46% of Earth's water surface.
It contains the deepest point on Earth, the Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench.

oceans.name: Atlantic Ocean
oceans.description: The Atlantic Ocean is the second largest of the world's five oceans, with an area of about 85,133,000 km2 (32,870,000 sq mi). It covers approximately 17% of Earth's surface and about 24% of its water surface area.
fun_facts: The Atlantic Ocean is named after the Greek mythological figure Atlas.
The Mid-Atlantic Ridge, a submarine mountain range, runs down the center of the ocean.

oceans.name: Indian Ocean
oceans.description: The Indian Ocean is the third-largest of the world's five oceanic divisions, covering 70,560,000 km2 (27,240,000 sq mi) or approximately 20% of the water on Earth's surface.
fun_facts: It is the warmest ocean in the world.
It has been a hub of trade and cultural exchange for centuries.
It is home to many unique ecosystems, including coral reefs and mangroves.

oceans.name: Southern Ocean
oceans.description: The Southern Ocean, also known as the Antarctic Ocean, is the southernmost ocean, surrounding Antarctica. It is the second smallest ocean.
fun_facts: It is the only ocean that flows around the globe uninterrupted by land.
It plays a crucial role in regulating the global climate.
It is home to a unique and diverse range of marine life, including krill, penguins, and seals.

oceans.name: Arctic Ocean
oceans.description: The Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest of the world's five major oceans. It is located in the Northern Hemisphere and is mostly surrounded by North America and Eurasia.
fun_facts: It is the coldest of all the oceans.
Much of the ocean is covered by sea ice for most of the year.
It is home to unique wildlife, including polar bears and narwhals.
